intro: Tragium tenue, commonly known as the slender tragia, is a small annual flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster at the top of the stem. Tragium tenue is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sunny environments.
